Package gov.nasa.gsfc.spdf.ssc

Class SatelliteSituationCenter

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.gsfc.spdf.ssc.SatelliteSituationCenter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SatelliteSituationCenterInterface
    public class SatelliteSituationCenter
extends java.lang.Object
implements SatelliteSituationCenterInterface
    This class implements the XML Web Service interface to NASA's Satellite Situation Center.
    Author:
    B. Harris

      • VALID_IP_ADDRESS

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern VALID_IP_ADDRESS
        Regular expression for validating an IP address. It is not very strict (e.g., it considers 999.999.999.999 a valid IPv4 address), but should be good enough to stop malicious values. A good regex for IPv6 is very complicated but the following is good enough.

      • NON_ASCII

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern NON_ASCII

      • CLEAN_PATTERNS

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern[] CLEAN_PATTERNS
        Array of regex patterns used to clean strings of troublesome characters.

      • getAllSatellites

        public java.util.List<SatelliteDescription> getAllSatellites()
                                                      throws SSCExternalException
        Provides descriptions of all the Satellites available through this Web Service. The names are returned in ascending alphabetical order of the identifier values.
        Specified by:
        getAllSatellites in interface SatelliteSituationCenterInterface
        Returns:
        list containing the description of all the available satellites
        Throws:
        SSCExternalException - thrown if unable to fulfill request

      • getAllSpaseObservatories

        public java.util.List<SpaseObservatoryDescription> getAllSpaseObservatories()
                                                                     throws SSCExternalException
        Provides descriptions of all the Space Physics Archive Search and Extract (SPASE) Observatories available through this Web Service. See notes concerning SPASE support.
        Specified by:
        getAllSpaseObservatories in interface SatelliteSituationCenterInterface
        Returns:
        list containing the descriptions of all the available observatories
        Throws:
        SSCExternalException - thrown if unable to fulfill request

      • getSatelliteTime

        @Deprecated
public TimeInterval getSatelliteTime​(java.lang.String satellite)
                              throws SSCExternalException
        Deprecated.
        As of 2.0, this same information is available in the SatelliteDescription returned by getAllSatellites()
        Requests the time range of available location information for the specified satellite.
        Parameters:
        satellite - the identifier of the satellite whose location information time range is being requested
        Returns:
        TimeInterval containing the starting and ending date for which location information is available
        Throws:
        SSCExternalException - thrown if unable to fulfill request

      • getSatelliteResolution

        @Deprecated
public int getSatelliteResolution​(java.lang.String satellite)
                           throws SSCExternalException
        Deprecated.
        As of 2.0, this same information is available in the SatelliteDescription returned by getAllSatellites()
        Requests the maximum location information resolution (in seconds) available for the specified satellite. For example, a value of 60 indicates that location information is available down to a 60 second interval between points.
        Parameters:
        satellite - the identifier of the satellite whose resolution value is being requested
        Returns:
        the maximum location information resolution available (seconds)
        Throws:
        SSCExternalException - thrown if unable to fulfill request

      • getKmlFiles

        public FileResult getKmlFiles​(KmlRequest request)
                       throws SSCExternalException
        Requests various information (see KmlRequest) about a set of satellites and returns the information in one or more Open Geospatial Consortium Keyhole Markup Language (KML) files.
        Specified by:
        getKmlFiles in interface SatelliteSituationCenterInterface
        Parameters:
        request - specifies what data is being requested
        Returns:
        the requested data
        Throws:
        SSCExternalException - if unable to fulfill request
        SSCResourceLimitExceededException - if unable to fulfill request due to a server resource limit
        SSCDatabaseLockedException - if unable to fulfill the request due to the satellite database being locked.
        Since:
        2.2.8

        private void logCall​(java.lang.String method,

                     java.util.Date startTime,

                     GraphOptions options)

        executeTime - time spent executing this method in milliseconds
        satellites - value of satellites parameter
        coordSystem - value of coordSystem parameter
        resolutionFactor - value of resolutionFactor parameter
        startTime - value of startTime parameter
        endTime - value of endTime parameter
        options - value of options parameter

        private void setServletAttribute​(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.Object object)
        Binds an object to a given attribute name in this servlet context. If the name specified is already used for an attribute, this method will replace the attribute with the new to the new attribute.
        Parameters:
        name - a String specifying the name of the attribute.
        object - an Object representing the attribute to be bound.

      • getClient

        private java.lang.String getClient()
        Gets a string representation of the client's Internet Protocol address. This is designed to work from behind a proxy or through an ssh tunnel. An IPv6 address is [] quoated.
        Returns:
        a string representation of the client's Internet Protocol address.

      • getServerName

        private java.lang.String getServerName()
        Returns the host name of the server to which the request was sent. It is the value of the part before ":" in the Host header value, if any, or the resolved server name, or the server IP address.
        Returns:
        a String containing the name of the server.

      • getServerPort

        private int getServerPort()
        Returns the port number to which the request was sent. It is the value of the part after ":" in the Host header value, if any, or the server port where the client connection was accepted on.
        Returns:
        an integer specifying the port number.

      • getRequestUrl

        private java.lang.String getRequestUrl()
        Returns the URL the client used to make this request.
        Returns:
        URL the client used to make this request.

        private java.lang.String getPublicUrlRoot()
        Returns the root URL (part before the path).
        Returns:
        root URL.

      • getHttpClient

        private java.lang.String getHttpClient()
        Attempts to get the IP address of the client from the HttpHeaders. In particular, the X-Forwarded-For header is examined.
        Returns:
        IP address of the client or null if it cannot be found.

      • getForwardedForClient

        private java.lang.String getForwardedForClient​(java.lang.String headerValue)
        Parses the given X-Forwarded-For HTTP header value for the original client (left-most value).
        Parameters:
        headerValue - an X-Forwarded-For header value to parse.
        Returns:
        the original client who initiated the request or null if the value is not found.

      • localFilenames2PublicUrls

        private void localFilenames2PublicUrls​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> filenames)
        Converts the given local filenames to public URLs.
        Parameters:
        filenames - the local filenames to convert to public URLs.

      • localFilenames2PublicUrls

        private void localFilenames2PublicUrls​(FileResult results)
        Converts any local filenames in the given FileResult to public URLs.
        Parameters:
        results - FileResult whose local filenames are to be converted to public URLs.

      • logableFormat

        public static java.lang.String logableFormat​(java.lang.String value)
        Reformats the given String into a format that is suitable for logging. That is, remove non-ascii, ascii-control, and non-printable Unicode characters. If any characters are removed a hexidecimal representation of the original value is prepended to the end of the "clean" value that is returned.
        Parameters:
        value - the String that is to be made suitable for logging.
        Returns:
        reformated version of the given value that is suitable for logging.

      • logRecord

        private java.lang.StringBuilder logRecord​(java.lang.String method,
                                          long executeTime,
                                          java.lang.String coordSystem,
                                          int resolutionFactor,
                                          java.util.Date startTime,
                                          java.util.Date endTime)
        Produces a StringBuilder containing the portion of a log record containing the given parameter values.
        Parameters:
        method - name method called
        executeTime - time spent executing this method in milliseconds
        coordSystem - value of coordSystem parameter
        resolutionFactor - value of resolutionFactor parameter
        startTime - value of startTime parameter
        endTime - value of endTime parameter
        Returns:
        StringBuilder containing a partial log record
